page.title: 13Our Local Park
page.content: Mugdrum Park lies at the west end of the High Street next to the bowling club, stretching from the High Street almost right down to the River Tay. At the bottom of the park near the river there are swings, a slide, climbing frame and a rocket. In the middle of the park there is a roundabout, climbing frame and swings. At the top of the park there are two trampolines, swingball facilities and a Putting Green. Opening hours are Mon. to Fri. 6pm to 8pm and at the weekend 2pm to 5pm and 6pm to 8pm. The Highland games are held in the park every year. This year and in 1984 Geoff Capes competed in the Tossing the Caber event and in 1983 Radio Tay visited the games. The opening day of the Newburgh Festival is held in Mugdrum Park.
